Description: Limewood portrait of a woman: the richly bejeweled woman in the panel portrait is portrayed with elegance and sophistication, with sweet, refined features. The necklace inset with precious stones and diadem; the jewellery-detail in added gold leaf.
Findspot: Found/Acquired: Kom el-Kharaba el-Kebir (Previously recorded as Rubaiyat)
Curator's comments: Bibliography: S. Walker and M. Bierbrier, 'Fayum. Misteriosi volti dall'Egitto' (London, 1997), p. 117 [87]; N. Strudwick, Masterpieces of Ancient Egypt, London 2006, pp. 312-3.
Bibliographic references: Doxiadis 1995 / The mysterious Fayum portraits: faces from ancient Egypt. (21)
Russmann 2001 / Eternal Egypt: Masterworks of Ancient Art from the British Museum (109)
Parlasca & Seeman 1999 / Augenblicke. Mumienporträts und ägyptische Grabkunst aus römischer Zeit (p.163, no.60)

Newman et al 2013 / The study and conservation of four ancient Egyptian funerary portraits: provenance, conservation history and structural treatment (p.1-13, p.2, fig.1, p.4, table.1, p.6, fig.5, p.8, fig.7, p.9, fig.8, p.10, fig.9, p.11, fig.10) (Portrait A)
Exhibition history: 1990 24 Mar-10 Jun, Australia, Canberra, National Gallery of Australia, Civilization: Ancient Treasures from the British Museum, cat. no.52 1990 28 Jun-23 Sep, Australia, Melbourne, Museum of Victoria, Civilization: Ancient Treasures from the British Museum, cat. no.52 1997 22 Oct-1998 30 Apr, Italy, Rome, Fondaione Memmo, Ancient Faces 2018 23 Feb – 22 Apr, Nashville, Frist Art Museum, 'Rome; City &Empire' 2018-2019 20 Sep-04 Feb, Canberra, National Museum of Australia, 'Rome; City &Empire'
Acquisition name: Bequeathed by: Sir Robert Ludwig Mond
